(Fall 2019  Capstone I Class Meet Time & Location:  Monday 11:00AM - 01:30PM  Room NAC 6/268 ) Courses Taught in the Past Our 2011-2012 Capstone Team V.I.S.T.A. won the $50000 Kaylie Prize First Place  (See also The City College Kaylie Prize for Entrepreneurship ). The team, "VISTA Wearable," includes four senior computer engineering majors - Daniel Zuleta, Frank Palmer, Cindy Rodriguez, and Javier Montesino - and doctoral student in psychology, Lei Ai. Professor of Computer Science Zhigang Zhu and Professor of Psychology Tony Ro advised the team. GesTherapy, Using gesture based therapy to remodel physical rehabilitation, Dean's Prize of the 2013 CCNY Kaylie Entrepreneurship Competition.. Team members: Luis Disla, Shaofeng Liu, Owais Naeem, Tanjin Panna.(mentors: Zhigang Zhu/CS at CCNY, Hao Tang/BMCC) Co-Advisors for HAST as the 2015 Social Innovation Prize Winner ($30K), Zahn Innovation Center. Project Title: HAST: Health and Support Technology for Families using Open Source Wearable Devices. Team members (Joint Senior Design Class Students): Benjamin Tan (EE), Bin Xu (EE), Ni Yao (CpE) and Xue Bin Zhao (CS). Mentor: Professors Jizhong Xiao and Zhigang Zhu. Three 2015-2016 Capstone Student Teams won CREATE Awards from New York State Industries for the Disabled, Inc. (NYSID); Four CREATE Awards  in 2016-2017.   This is a testimony of Prof. Zhigang Zhu, among others. Our Two Capstone CREATE Teams in 2017 -2018: ASSIST (Assistive Sensor Solution for Independent and Safe Travel, by Vishnu Nair and Manjekar Budhai) was in the Spectrum Local News (Manjekar talking at the meeting while Vishnu testing in the field), and AVR4ASD (Augmented and Virtual Reality for Individuals with Autism Spectrum Disorder, by Xinyu Xiong, Rafael Li Chen and Yuxuan Huang) won the Second Place Prize of the CREATE Competition (in the picture: Rafael, Xinyu and Prof. Zhigang Zhu). This is a partnership with Ms. Celina Canvalluzzi, Director of Day Services at Goodwill Industries of Greater New York and Northern New Jersey.  More details please see a news release at CCNY. Research Projects Some Current Research Projects ( a more complete list can be found here) Smart  and Accessible Transportation Hub (CUNY Newswire | CCNY News) - NSF Partnerships for Innovation (PFI) Project (Primary Industrial Partner: Bentley Systems, Incorporated ) - NSF Smart and Connected Community (S&CC) Project - DHS Summer Research Team Project - Bentley CRA Project at CUNY Multimodal Sensing, Display and Learning for the Visually Challenged - NSF EFRI Research Award - VentureWell (formerly NCIIA) Course Award - NSF GARDE Funding Support for Course Development - For more information of the EFRI grant, please see a news post about the projects. - Slides with 16 poems (in both Chinese and English) summarizing the related research, first presented at Robotics and Computer Science:toward continued collaboration between CCNY(USA) and Kyutech (Japan), 8 September, 2017. A research summary article (in Chinese) based on these poems was published in Overseas Scholars, Special Issue on Information Technology, Chinese Association for Science and Technology, USA (CAST-USA), 2017. NSF I-Corps Award: Transforming 2D Video into an Interactive 3D Viewing Experience Past Research Projects Multimodal Sensing and 3D Understanding: for surveillance, robotics and e-education.
